summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department, providing the password for a drive and CD containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, transmitting discovery materials to the detention center.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell and is responsible for providing discovery materials in her case.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a letter containing passwords to access discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a drive and a CD containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell's case.
The letter is addressed to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department, indicating Maxwell was likely in custody there at the time.
Audrey Strauss was serving as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York as of November 18, 2020.
The document demonstrates the procedural step of providing discovery materials to the defense or detention facility in a high-profile case.
